Body:
Description: Hi Team,

I'm creating current ticket on behalf of Directi team.
They noticed that even though "Disable Bluetooth File Transfer" is turned ON for the test Windows computer, they can still transfer files via Bluetooth.

EPP Server version: 5.9.4.1.
EPP client version: 6.2.4.2000

Please let us know if additional details would be needed to proceed with the investigation of the described behavior.

Thank you,

Oana Nemes | Team Lead, Customer Success
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com  
(+40) 264-593 110

What We've Learned Updated: Client is trying to block the ability to transfer files via bluetooth from the computers to other devices. Seems like the option ''Disable Bluetooth File Transfer'' doesn't work for them.

Next Steps Updated: Tested out the feature on my end and tried to send a file from my device to my personal smartphone and the ability was blocked accordingly.Followed up with the client on how to properly test. Will wait for their response.
Next Steps Updated: Client confirmed that the issue has been fixed by following the provided steps.
